instructions: 1. Season steaks with salt and pepper on both sides, and rub them all over with oil.
2. Heat a grill pan over high heat and cook the steaks until browned on one side, about 2 to 3 minutes.
3. Flip steaks and cook on the other side until just browned, about 2 to 3 minutes. Donâ€™t overcook, or you'll run the risk of toughening the meat.
4. Remove steaks to plates to let the meat rest. Turn off the heat and add 2 tablespoons butter to the skillet to melt.
5. Drizzle the melted butter and juices from the skillet on the steaks.
Adapted from: https://www.thespruceeats.com/steak-medley-date-night-meal-912501
name: Steak
description: A delicious serving of steak for one.

instructions: 1. Crack two eggs into bowl.
2. Grate cheese into separate bowl.
3. Add cheese, salt, and pinch of oregano into bowl with eggs.
3. Throughly beat eggs until uniform.
4. Pour egg mix into frying pan on medium heat until bottom is light-golden.
5. Flip omelette and fry until light-golden.
name: Omelette
description: A classic omelette with light seasoning and cheese.

instructions: 1. Spread mayo onto one slice of bread
2. Cut lettuce into thin slices, cut and wash.
3. Pile the ingredients in the following order: cheese, turkey breast, bacon, lettuce, other slice of bread.
name: Turkey BLT
description: A classic sandwich that everyone loves

instructions: 2. Cut lettuce into thin slices, wash, and dry.
2. Put lettuce into bowl, and add croutons and dressing.
3. Mix well.
name: Caesar Salad
description: A solid side-salad for any good meal

instructions: 1. Cut bagel into two, and toast to light golden-brown.
2. Spread cream cheese onto bagel slices.
name: Cream Cheese Bagel
